metadata.source: MISRA C:2025 Addendum 6 - Applicability of MISRA C:2025 to the Rust Language

applicability_values.Yes: The MISRA C guideline applies equally to the Rust language
applicability_values.No: The MISRA C guideline does not apply to the Rust language
applicability_values.Partial: The MISRA C guideline partially applies to some aspects of the Rust language

adjusted_category_values.required: Code shall comply with this guideline, with a formal deviation required where this is not the case
adjusted_category_values.advisory: These are recommendations which should be followed as far as is reasonably practical
adjusted_category_values.disapplied: Guidelines for which compliance is not required. No enforcement is expected
adjusted_category_values.implicit: The behaviour is not permitted by Rust (compiler enforces)
adjusted_category_values.n_a: The behaviour does not apply to Rust

rationale_values.UB: The MISRA C guideline applies to C Undefined Behaviour
rationale_values.IDB: The MISRA C guideline applies to C Implementation-defined Behaviour
rationale_values.CQ: The MISRA C guideline applies to Code Quality considerations
rationale_values.DC: The MISRA C guideline applies to Design Considerations

decidability_values.Decidable: Can be checked by static analysis
decidability_values.Undecidable: Cannot be fully checked by static analysis

scope_values.STU: Single Translation Unit - analysis confined to one compilation unit
scope_values.System: Requires system-wide analysis across multiple compilation units

Dir 4.1.comment: often in the form of panics

Dir 4.6.comment: all primitive types already fulfil this

Dir 5.1.comment: not all safe Rust types are race-free

Rule 1.4.comment: this is specific to C versioning

Rule 2.4.comment: no separate tag name space in Rust

Rule 5.1.comment: no character limit, except in extern “C”

Rule 5.2.comment: no character limit, but has name spaces

Rule 5.3.comment: this also applies to macro names

Rule 5.5.comment: macros and functions use different syntax

Rule 5.7.comment: no separate tag name space in Rust

Rule 5.10.comment: only possible in some cases. Previously Rule 21.2

Rule 6.1.comment: only provided as a library feature

Rule 7.1.comment: Rust octals have a distinct prefix from decimals

Rule 7.2.comment: this is an error by default but can be enabled

Rule 8.3.comment: an extern declaration shall have a type compatible with the C declaration

Rule 8.7.comment: items should not be declared pub if referenced in only one crate

Rule 8.16.comment: cannot be explicitly specified. Only ZSTs have this alignment

Rule 9.1.comment: enforced by rustc but can be bypassed by unsafe

Rule 10.5.comment: includes both safe `as` and unsafe `transmute` operations

Rule 10.8.comment: includes both safe `as` and unsafe `transmute` operations

Rule 11.1.comment: includes both safe `as` and unsafe `transmute` operations

Rule 11.9.comment: Rust does not have a null pointer constant

Rule 12.4.comment: this is either well-defined or will not occur

Rule 13.1.comment: order of evaluation is strict in Rust

Rule 13.2.comment: order of evaluation is strict in Rust

Rule 13.6.comment: this is not an expression operator in Rust

Rule 16.4.comment: a corresponding match expression must be complete

Rule 16.5.comment: irrefutable pattern causes a subsequent refutable one to be unreachable

Rule 17.4.comment: the return keyword is not needed to return a value in Rust, only to exit

Rule 17.8.comment: this cannot be done accidentally without declaring parameters `mut`

Rule 17.9.comment: this is expressed with the `!` (Never) type, and enforced by rustc

Rule 17.11.comment: a non-returning function can be declared to return a value type

Rule 18.4.comment: applies to use of the unsafe API

Rule 20.1.comment: rules specific to the C preprocessor do not apply to Rust

Rule 20.4.comment: possible with raw identifiers but the compiler prevents visual conflicts

Rule 20.7.comment: possible to express with procedural macros only, not macro_rules

Rule 22.1.comment: applies to resources acquired through FFI only

Rule 22.14.comment: applies to creating synchronization objects before threads that use them

Rule 22.15.comment: applies to releasing synchronization objects after threads that use them
